data.name: Countdown
data.description:
Write a function that accepts on parameter, `time`. It will be an integer, and represents a period of time in milliseconds, much like the `Date` object.

Your job is to return a "countdown" string, representing the approximate amount of time left in the `time` argument. A tilde ("~") should be added to the front of the string, reminding the recipient of the string that it is meant as an approximation only. Once you get down to individual seconds (t < 20 seconds), you can leave the tilde off.

There should only be one time measurement given, the largest whole unit (days/hours/minutes/seconds). It should adhere to the following logic:

###Days
Eg. Time | Eg. Output
-|-
132:01:54:23 | "~132 days"
005:16:34:12 | "~5 days"
001:00:00:01 | "~1 day"

### Hours
Range (in hours) | Set to | Eg. Time | Eg. Output
---|----|---|----
12 <= t < 24 | 24 (1 day) | 13:09:45 | "~1 day"
9 < t < 12 | 12 | 09:56:41 | "~12 hours"
6 <= t <= 9 | 6 | 07:22:34 | "~6 hours"
1 <= t < 6 | whole hours | 03:45:01 | "~3 hours"
"        | "  | 01:00:00 | "~1 hour"

### Minutes
Range (in minutes) | Set to | Eg. Time | Eg. Output
-------------|---------------------|----------|---------------
50 <= t < 60 | 60 (1 hour)   | 00:50:32 | "~1 hour"
40 <= t < 50 | 40 | 00:42:12 | "~40 minutes"
20 <= t < 40 | 20 | 00:36:05 | "~20 minutes"
1 <= t < 20  | whole minutes                   | 00:08:59 | "~8 minutes"
"             |   "                  | 00:01:23 | "~1 minute"

### Seconds
Range (in seconds) | Set to | Eg. time | Eg. output
-------------|---------------------|-------------|---------------
50 <= t < 60 | 60 (1 minute) | 00:00:53    | "~1 minute"
40 <= t < 50 | 40 | 00:00:47    | "~40 seconds"
20 <= t < 40 | 20 | 00:00:32    | "~20 seconds"
1 < t < 20   | whole seconds |  00:00:15    | "15 seconds"
0 < t <= 1   | 1                   | 00:00:1.341 | "1 second"
       "      |  "                   | 00:00:0.115 | "1 second"

### Done

Range (in milliseconds) | Output
-|-
t <= 0 | "done"
